title: Special Topics in Public Policy; Global Perspectives on Leading and Investing in Social Change
description: In this course students will discuss the history, development, roles, and issues related to philanthropy in U.S. society, particularly in relationship to giving toward global, international challenges that cross national boundaries. We will also examine the habits and approaches of successful public and community leaders by examining case studies and course readings that will inform our giving strategy and decisions. Students will complete the course with an understanding of the leadership needed to make philanthropic investments and to achieve social change from various places in the international philanthropic ecosystem including as a volunteer, donor, and board member of an international humanitarian organization.
